channel.title: Run wont work in source
channel.description:
ok so when i click on run i get this in my command prompt
Error: could not open `C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\lib\amd64\jvm.cfg' Press any key to continue . . .

item.title: Run wont work in source
item.dc:creator: @fakx fakx
item.description:
@fakx wrote:

Sometimes its something like Jre1.7.0.0.1, u remove the numbers after the 7, or you can go to enviroment variables and creat CLASSPATH and PATH, you can simply find out how to do that by a youtube search, theres simple fixes for such on youtube.

Read full topic

item.title: Run wont work in source
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“imstrength, post:3, topic:464466”]this is posted twice for you…clearly you need to read the responses you get to fix the issue. now either you are still using jre6 or you are on program (x86), or both…so try all of these…

C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre7\lib\amd64\jvm.cfg

C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\lib\amd64\jvm.cfg

C:\Program Files\Java (x86)\jre6\lib\amd64\jvm.cfg[/quote]

On program x86?
Let’s just state a few facts…
x86 - 32bit
x64 - 64bit
The bit depends on the compatibility with a certain binary instruction set.

On Topic, imstrength is partially right, however his solution wont work for everyone, Does the directory, “C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\lib\amd64” exist? If so, is the jvm.cfg file found with-in the contents.

Read full topic
